section.section:
"Qualified person" does not include:
an automobile collision insurer or other insurer that seeks by subrogation to recover payment for damages to a motor vehicle or real or other personal property, or injuries to individuals under any insurance coverages, including collision, fire, theft, medical payments, and uninsured motorist coverages;
a holder of a certificate of self-insurance under this article; or
an insured under a policy provision that:

text.section:
To the extent that a policy of motor vehicle liability insurance does not provide coverage, a claim that arises out of circumstances described in subsection (c), (d), or (e) of this section may be made against the Fund if:
the claim is for:
damage to property greater than $250; or
the death of or personal injury to a qualified person;
at the time of the accident, the claimant was not driving or riding in an uninsured motor vehicle owned by the claimant or a member of the claimant's family who resides in the claimant's household; and
the claimant is not the personal representative of the individual who was driving or riding in the uninsured motor vehicle; and
at the time of the accident, the claimant was not driving a motor vehicle with a certificate of registration that was suspended, canceled, or revoked, or was holding a driver's license that was suspended, canceled, or revoked; and
the claimant is not the personal representative or a member of the family who resides in the household of the individual who was driving the motor vehicle.

section.section:
A claim under this subsection may not be made by or for:
an insurer under a policy that makes the insurer liable to pay, wholly or partly, the amount of the claim; or
an insurer for any amount sought or claimed for damages or destruction to the property of the claimant or an insured by reason of:

The amount to be paid out of the Fund may not be sought, wholly or partly, to:
take the place of making a claim or receiving a payment that is payable under a policy specified in paragraph (2)(i) of this subsection; or
reimburse or otherwise indemnify an insurer for an amount paid or payable under a policy specified in paragraph (2)(i) of this subsection.
